quotes.quote: Observation is an old man's memory.
Observation capitalizes inspiration.
Observation, not old age, brings wisdom.
Is there an observation which is not the instrument of thought?
Where observation is concerned, chance favors only the prepared mind.
Observations not only disturb what is to be measured, they produce it.
Extraordinary observations require extraordinary evidence to make them believable.
In the mere observation of yourself, you begin the process of healing and transformation.
The power of accurate observation is commonly called cynicism by those who have not got it.
All observations of life are harsh, because life is. I lament that fact, but I cannot change it.
A few observation and much reasoning lead to error; many observations and a little reasoning to truth.
True observation begins when devoid of set patterns; freedom of expression occurs when one is beyond system.
It's on the strength of observation and reflection that one finds a way. So we must dig and delve unceasingly.
If there's one observation that rings true in today's changing world, it is that freedom and peace go hand in hand.
The attitude of silent observation is the very foundation of yoga. You see the picture, but you are not the picture.
That observation which is called knowledge of the world will be found much more frequently to make men cunning than good.
A journey of observation must leave as much as possible to chance. Random movement is the best plan for maximum observation
A careful observation of Nature will disclose pleasantries of superb irony. She has for instance placed toads close to flowers.
It is the close observation of little things which is the secret of success in business, in art, in science, and in every pursuit of life.
Observation always involves theory.
When you make an observation, you have an obligation.
The observation of nature is part of an artist's life.
Self-observation is the first step of inner unfolding.
Observation is the most enduring of the pleasures of life.
Let observation with extended observation observe extensively.
Reason, observation, and experience; the holy trinity of science.
Accuracy of observation is the equivalent of accuracy of thinking.
One man's observation is another man's closed book or flight of fancy.
Observation and study are necessary to achieve mastery of light and form
Direct observation of the luminous essence of nature is for me indispensable
